summary: aberrant glycosylation of membrane components due to specific alterations of glycosylation activity is a common feature of carcinoma cells. gastric cancer is the fourth most common malignancy and the second leading cause of cancer-related mortality in the world. the expression level of 4GnT mRNA is increased in association with tumor progression. ppGalNAc-T2 is a member of the ppGalNAc-T family which catalyzes the attachment of the first N-acetylgal actosaminyltransferase 2 (ppGalNAc-T2) to the polypeptide at the initiation of O-linked glycosylation of proteins. ppGalNac-T2 expression appears to be higher in gastric cancer SGC7901 cells than in other poorly differentiated human cancer cells. however, a comprehensive understanding of how ppGalNAc-T2 correlates with the invasive potential of human gastric cancer is not currently available. ppGalNAc-T2 gene is useful in regulating gastric carcinoma invasion and metastasis. pEGFP-C1-ppGalNAc-T2 sense vectors and
